direction.raw_text: The el train RUMBLES north past the aging tenements of Uptown into the Belmont Avenue Station. And down below, a garbage truck is slowly working its way up the alley. A garbage man in city overalls WHISTLES to the driver and the truck stops. He rolls a can to the grinding jaw as the driver sits, tense and alert, scanning the street. There's something odd about this driver. And the garbage man too, for that matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a nervous looking black man, steps out onto the platform. As the train pulls away we see him reach into his shirt pocket and CLICKS his ball point pen a couple of times. He WHISPERS into it. It is a concealed radio transmitter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He heads for the stairs and the street below.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Say, hey, Cub fans, I hope to hell y'all down there cause we got a big game today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The truck cab is equipped with a police radio. The driver, RICH DONATO, adjusts the volume. Over the SPEAKER, HEAVY WITH STATIC, we can hear the SOUND of the RECEDING EL TRAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato motions for the garbage man.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) The school bus be waitin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: jumps up on the truck's running board and sticks his head in. On the seat beside Donato is a sledgehammer and a sawed off automatic rifle. The two men stare at each other as they concentrate on the CRACKLING RADIO.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) S'happenin, Doc?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Hey, I got it all right here, my man. Jus be waitin on you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) We ain't got far to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: is at the wheel of a late model Cadillac. Spider gets in and they pull slowly away from the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the corner in a beat up Pontiac are officers MUSIC and BRENNAN. The two rough looking detectives follow Doc's car through half closed eyes. They also HEAR Spider's TRANSMITTER. The quality of the reception improves as Spider and his antennae clear the steel support structure of the el platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doc and Spider talk in a nervous false bravado.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) This early bird shit just ain't my style.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Dig it. Too close to real work for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie nods to Donato who grabs a walkie-talkie from the seat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to walkie-talkie) O.K. Home Team. Ready in the bullpen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Copy Shortstop. Double play. We're with him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Center's in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Eddie looks at Donato.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where's Cragie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two cops are against the wall separating the cemetery from the El. CRAGIE, a weathered twenty-five year veteran; and NICK KOSALAS, the new kid on the team. Cragie sits on a crate with a styrofoam cup of coffee. Kosalas is trying to maneuver his cup lid off, and still hold on to his walkie-talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie pulls a pint of whiskey from his pocket and sweetens his coffee with a healthy shot. He notices Kosalas, who has set down the thermos and is nervously moving from leg to leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie grins and raises his cup to drink. His hand shakes and he has to steady it with the other. The RADIO CRACKLES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Talk to me left field.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to mike) Ready sir. Left Field in position.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have a shot, kid. A little nerve tonic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter with you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) O.K., guys, runner on first base.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A spotter, KOBAS, covers the scene from an abandoned building across the street.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to walkie-talkie) Just turning on Paulina.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Double Play, you got him in sight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Yeah, we got the on him. He's headin for the alley.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie wrestles another garbage can into the truck's hopper as Doc's car cruises slowly past. Eddie and Spider LOCK EYES for a split second. The car moves on and stops at the far end of the alley. The lights switch off. After a moment, Spider and Doc leave the car and check out the scene. Doc carries a satchel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men slip into the back gate of an old tenement. They pass through a gangway to the front of the building, and climb the front stairs. Though we can no longer see them, we HEAR a DOOR OPENING, a GREETING in Spanish, and FEET FOUNDING up the steps. The garbage truck GRINDS forward and halts again. Eddie comes up to the cab. He is wearing a gun under his overalls. He and Donato listen on the RADIO to the CONVERSATION coming from inside the building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) I say nice and simple now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) We real cool, Doc. We're frosty. We jus' doin' a little business, you know? Ain't no big thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A muscular Latino, POMPAS COMACHO, leads Spider and Doc down the paint-peeling corridor. The SOUND of BABIES CRYING and FAMILIES WAKING gives a sense of teeming humanity behind every door. The Latino knocks at a door heavily fortified with burglar bars. The door opens. The bars are unlocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pompas leaves the two men and heads down the stairs toward the front door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How y'all doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from within) It's O.K. O.K. Como esta?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doc and Spider enter. They're patted down. A sleepy eyed Latino woman comes to stand in the bedroom doorway. VICTOR COMACHO barks at her in Spanish, and she disappears into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie stands on the running board of the truck with Donato at the wheel. They listen to the RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie tosses a soiled Rubic's Cube into Donato's lap.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Hey, man, we're clean, huh. We ain't fools.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You do that real nice, Pancho. what say we get married.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Found you a present.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit, those things will fuck up your mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cragie is watching over the wall with his binoculars. He looks back at Kosalas, who is hopping from foot to foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie laughs and swigs straight from the bottle. The RADIO CRACKLES.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: If you gotta take a leak, do it now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't go wading in with my shlong flapping in the wind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure you can. It's called diversionary tactics.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) What's going on in the ballpark?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Don't get froggy. Wait for the green light.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A painter's van passes Brennan's Pontiac and parks in front of the building half way up the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music doesn't like this.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is this cat up to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Going to work asshole. What do you think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At this hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got a hardass for a boss. Like us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Music and Brennan watch from their car, the four painters get out of their truck, unpack their ladders and tools, and begin to carry their equipment into the building next door to the stakeout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is small and bare. A selling den. VICTOR COMACHO and TWO COUSINS, all young and vicious, are sitting around a formica table with the two buyers, Doc and Spider. The Comachos are heavily armed. There is plenty of tension all around, but Doc seems a little more nervous than the rest. This is an enormous buy. Doc has placed a bowling satchel full of bundled $20's, $50's, and $100's on the table. Victor is counting it rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor nods and one of the cousins brings in half a dozen brick-sized bundles of cocaine from the next room. Doc slices into one of the bags and with the tip of his knife he drops a bit into a glass vial. He adds clear liquid with an eye dropper and it instantly turns purple.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This be better than jukin' Seven- Elevens, huh Victor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to cousins in Spanish) This one's got some balls, huh? (to Spider) I don't juke anybody.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I say, awright. The royal colors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie's eyes scan the scene as he sorts through a garbage can with a stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The painters carry their equipment down the long corridor and enter a vacant apartment. A door opens in the corridor, and a naked toddler steps out. A Latino teenager comes out to retrieve the child. He sees the backs of the painters, and carries the toddler back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The painters are not what they seem. Working quickly, silently, they open their tool kits and lay out their hardware: machine guns and automatics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a barrel-chested Italian mobster is running the show and it's well rehearsed. His boys, GUS, VITO, and EENIE move like oiled machinery. Vito turns on a radio to a Latino station to cover the SOUND of their preparations. They remove the whole window from its frame. Then they rest a wide plank on the window ledge. Three feet away is the window of the adjacent building and silhouetted against the shade we can SEE the drug deal. Luna'ys check their weapons. They put on painters' masks and goggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts on his goggles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, by the numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Over the IDLING ENGINE of the garbage truck, Eddie and Donato HEAR the deal going down on the RADIO.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie looks at Donato.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like a coiled spring, Eddie leaps from the truck and runs for the rear gate, gun in hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to walkie-talkie) Everybody on your toes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Their Right Field's Clear. Those painters are out of the way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to walkie-talkie) What the hell you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) We got a painting crew of painters just went in the building next door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Painters? That building's gonna be condemned!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Play Ball! Play-fucking-ball!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to mike) Home Team! We're goin in! Move it! Move it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tony and his men face the window across the gangway. Two of them hold sawed off double barreled shotguns. Tony counts it down, and they all fire as one. One GIANT BLAST tears into the window. It disintegrates. The four men toss aside their empty guns, and grab other guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie HEARS THE GUNFIRE and hits the wall. He sees the glass showering down around him. He vaults over the backyard fence and head for the porch stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas is finally pissing against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie is using the crate to climb the wall. He is up and over, and falls to the ground on the other side. He's still trying to get to his feet when Kosalas comes over. They start running, yanking their guns out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I knew it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Doc and Spider are blown backwards in their chairs. One of the cousins has fallen across the piles of money and drugs. Victor and the other cousin are slumped on the floor. The woman in the bedroom is screaming. Through the jagged glass around the window frame, Tony's boys shove a broad plank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three floors up, we see the "painters" rush across the gangway to the other building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the heavyweight guarding the back door, is distracted by the SHOUTS and GUNFIRE upstairs. Eddie crashes through the door and Efren spins just in time to meet Eddie's blurring attack. The struggle on the landing is brief. Efren's size is no match for Eddie's speed and power. With a grunt he sags to the floor. Eddie leaps over him and bounds up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brennan, Music and Kobas are now on their way, using parked cars to cover their advance toward the front door of the Comacho building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie passes the second floor landing and takes a quick look up the porch stairs. The door to the second floor apartment starts to open behind him. He spins and kicks it. There stands a terrified old woman looking up the barrel of his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spins and bounds up the stairway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (shouts) Police! No se mueve!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The woman is huddled in a corner, still screaming. Tony comes to stand over her, and coldly shoots her. Then he rips off his mask and goggles as his boys clear the bodies and scoop up the drugs and money from the table. Victor Comacho lies slumped against the wall, one side of his face and one shoulder bloodied. He appears dead, eyes open. But then he blinks once.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie has entered the rear of the apartment. He moves cautiously forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony and his partners start back over the gangway to the other building. Vito is bringing up the rear. Suddenly Victor Comacho comes to life. He gets off A BURST with his AUTOMATIC. Vito catches it in the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato is moving down the gangway when Vito's body -- followed by the scaffold plank -- falls from the sky and CRASHES into the pavement right in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie jumps into the living room doorway, gun drawn, and takes in the carnage. He kicks the gun out of Victor's hand, and bounds to the shattered bay window and looks down in time to SEE -- EXT. GANGWAY - DAY Donato jumps over the broken body, running through the gangway toward the front of the building.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: They're goin out the front!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The bridge to the other building is gone, but there is a large drainpipe running down the outside of the building. Eddie climbs out on the shattered window sill, and stretches for the pipe. The pipe is just out of reach. Pushing off from the ledge, he jumps for the drainpipe, grabbing it on his way down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he slides down three stories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The painters run down the stairs toward the front of the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music, Brennan, and Kobas rush the front door of the Comacho's building, and enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie lands on his feet and heads for the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie and Kosalas brace themselves on each side of the rear door to the Painters' building. Cragie is white with fear. Kosalas kicks in the door. They enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the front of the building Donato emerges from the passageway and he's met by a HAIL of GUNFIRE. He jumps back and takes a more cautious look. Tony Luna and Gus make a run for the van. Donato steps out from between the two buildings and raises his gun. But he hasn't seen Eenie, just coming out of the building next door. Eenie fires and Donato goes down, wounded in the foot. But before Eenie can get off another shot -- -- Eddie leaps from the gangway and drops Eenie with a BURST from his AUTOMATIC.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luna pulls out PEELING RUBBER, but he's nearly surrounded. squad cars have pulled in blocking both ends of the street. Another squad car screeches to a halt and both officers jump out and start firing. Luna hits the fender of the squad car head on, knocking both officers to the ground. He spins the van around with cops FIRING from every angle, jumps the curb, and roars past the roadblock on the sidewalk with pedestrians leaping in all directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heart pounding, Cragie leads Kosalas blindly up the darkened steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A door opens behind Cragie. He whirls and FIRES into the darkness. The riddled body of a Mexican teenager, eyes wide with shock, pitches into the hall. Kosalas, down the hallway, hugs the wall, petrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas creeps ahead, gun drawn, just in time to see Cragie pull a small handgun from his pocket and lay it in the boys hand. Cragie looks up at Kosalas and their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cragie?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's O.K. I got the sonovabitch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luna's van, it's windshield shot out, takes the first corner on two wheels. Behind him the police scramble for their blue and whites. Half way down the block, the van lurches into an alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The van hurtles down the alley, splashing through puddles past the loading docks of a packing company. Parked along one side of the end of the alley is a meat truck from the opening montage. A loading ramp leads to the gaping rear doors. The thieves have done their homework. The Luna gang slams up the ramp into the rear of the meat truck. A bee fy compatriot in a blood stained butcher's smock pulls several sides of beef along the rail and into the truck. With the van concealed, the line of police cars ROAR splashing by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie, kneeling over the body, looks at Kosalas eyeball to eyeball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: come from within the boy's apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They HEAR FOOTSTEPS pounding up the front stairs. Cragie and Kosalas look up. Eddie appears at the front of the hall, gun drawn. He sees the boy on the hallway floor. He approaches cautiously, taking in the body, the gun, Cragie sitting against the wall, and the distraught Kosalas who stands transfixed by the dead kid. Eddie goes to Kosalas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie looks at Cragie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Eddie and Cragie look at Kosalas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It almost sounds like an order. Kosalas looks like he's going to be sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling into the apartment) Police! Stay where you are!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take it easy, Kosalas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The kid didn't dust him. I did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Him or me, Sarge. (pause) The kid saw the whole thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell him, Nick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Yeah, that's how it went down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pause) Stay here. (to Cragie) Take care of your partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gangway is now filled with squad cars, ambulances, and cops. As the paramedics walk Victor Comacho to the ambulance, bloody, bandaged, but very much alive, he and Eddie LOCK EYES for a brief instant. Several ferocious looking Comacho relatives have been allowed inside the police lines. One of them steps close to Victor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lab technicians arrive. The throng of streetwise punks and horrified commuters are across a roped off area.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to relative) Call Luis.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get these people back out of here, wouldja.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kosalas and Cragie are still with the body. The corridor is blocked off by uniformed patrolmen. Kosalas is shakey. Cragie is tries to calm him down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look, it's no big thing, Kid. A friggin' dog and pony show. Some dumb ass questions by dumb ass bureaucrats. "When's the last time you were at the range?" Crap like that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look. It was a fuckin' accident. Why can't you just be -- CRAGIE (stiffens) You born yesterday?! These ain't cops. They'll roast our ass just cause we carry a badge. Both of us. (menacing) We stick together on this, kid. We're partners, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Donato sits on the ground as two paramedics work on his foot. Eddie crouches beside him as one medic cuts away Donato's ankle boot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gasps as they draw the boot off. Donato grabs for Eddie's hand, and squeezes against the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone points Eddie out to Partida, an attractive, no- nonsense woman, who heads for him. Donato sees Partida coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The resentment the other cops feel against Partida is readily apparent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partida looks at the covered body nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie smiles at Donato, who with his good foot, kicks at the medic bandaging the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Partida heads for the building, another suited civilian comes over to meet her. The civilian escorts a Mexican grandmother. The old lady is agitated, jabbering in Spanish and pointing at the cops. Eddie sees this, and then is pulled away as he helps one of the medics lift Donato and carry him to the ambulance. Eddie helps Donato into the ambulance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Aw man, don't do that. You know how much these things cost?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eddie. Scam this. A bait shop. Worms, minnows. Don't even need real worms. Storage problem. Got those rubber ones, you know?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, what about the winter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We winter in Florida. Rubber neck the beach bunnies. Aw, look at that. Ruined my brand new fence climbers. Hand made in Italy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, fuck, Partida. I'm gonna tell her you shot me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cusack. You were in charge here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does it look like it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Donato) And you were a principal in one of the shootings?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ! A goddamn Dr. Jekyll!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where's the officer who was involved in the other shooting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) Third floor rear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Catch you later, Hopalong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two Comacho lookouts who survived the raid, Efren and Pompas, have been brought in for questioning. The interrogation is taking place in a small room. Officers Brennan and Music are here with Eddie. The Comachos sit silent as stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Efren stares ahead. Music looks at Eddie who is fiddling with the Rubic's Cube, to little success. Brennan takes Music's place. He kicks Pompas' chair hard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a joke, but a threat. Pompas spits at Brennan. Brennan is enraged, but Eddie pushes him back with a hand. Eddie faces the Comachos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie goes out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Efren) You know that, Efren. When your big bad brother Luis gets the word, your ass is freeze dried and fried.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talk you hemorrhoid!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Spanish) Your mother fucks dogs in the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You wanna tune-up? Hey Sarge, you know why a Comacho's like a cue-ball? Cause the harder you hit 'em, the better their English gets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're jerking off here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Eddie emerges, he bumps into the Camacho's lawyer SANCHEZ; thirty-eight, well dressed, smooth as silk. Sanchez sees the tableau in the room. As Cusack walks down the hall the attorney follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez backs off. We follow Eddie down the hall.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let's cut the shit, Cusack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Option 1: you can send em downtown. If Judge Collins didn't get laid last night, you can probably get him to arraign my clients for loitering in their own hallway. He'll set bail. I'll take care of it. Option 2: release them here and now and we'll call it a day. (pause) Up to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like to see you earn your money.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The head of Area Four, COMMANDER KATES, is grilling Cragie and Kosalas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates turns to Kosalas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas looks haggard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie enters. Kates looks up from his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie gets up. Kosalas, sitting through this interview in stunned silence stands also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas and Cragie exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates sits, sighs, suddenly tired.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PHONE RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie starts to leave again. Kates picks up the phone, and puts a hand over the mouthpiece.

direction.raw_text: Eddie exits.

dialogue.raw_text: We come up the back stairs. We start cleanin' the hallway when the deceased pops out of a doorway with a 25 automatic. I tell him to drop it, but he's comin. We had no choice. Kosalas here saw the whole thing.

dialogue.raw_text: Did you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was on another doorway...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you saw the action?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw him fall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the kid was armed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's the way it went down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you saw the weapon?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods) Yes sir. I saw it in his hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K. (signs document) Cragie, you'll be assigned to headquarters until the hearing -- CRAGIE Hearing? Who called for a hearing? The little fuck tried to shoot me in the back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ms. Partida -- CRAGIE That piece of shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut-up, Cragie. (pause) Partida has demanded a formal hearing. You will be under oath so the department will provide you with a lawyer unless you've got your own. (stands) An OPS Review Board member is waiting to talk to you. Doesn't sound like you got anything to worry about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kosalas, you work with Cusack until this is over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't got no time to nursmaid a rookie. I don't need a partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (explodes) Your right! You don't need a partner! You need a goddamn keeper! (slams fist on desk) Jesus Christ! How do I explain this one upstairs? (stands) We gave you 600 man-hours, you took a month planning the damn thing, and what have you got to show for it? Nine bodies? A dead informant? One of my best men shot! For Christ's sake! (stares at ceiling) You're going to have me back on a beat busting perverts in the park.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got a bigger problem. These Comachos aren't gonna take this lying down. The animals are out of the cages.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just what I need. A goddman war.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep track of this business with Cragie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll deal with upstairs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just get me some answers, huh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my job.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kosalas, without an attorney, is being interviewed by Partida. A court stenographer is silently typing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...you have the right to remain silent. You have the right to have an attorney present at all times. Anything you say may be used against you in a court of law...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie and Kosalas are parked on an airport access road, watching private planes land and take off. Eddie's car, a five-year old Chevy, is wreckage. The quarter panels are rusted, the radio antenna is a coathanger, and when Kosalas pushes a tape into the cassette player, the windshield wipers start moving. Kosalas pops the cassette out, the windshield wipers stop; he throws the cassette into the glove compartment. But now he can't get the door to stay closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie has to shout to be heard over the sound of an airplane passing directly overhead. Eddie glances at Kosalas who looks uncomfortable.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to have to fix that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know, it's kind of interesting. That 16 year old in the hallway with the gun? Partida told me he doesn't have a record. The kid's never been arrested.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well, you know, if you read the papers, cops only shoot honor students. Sole support of the family and all that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The airport bristles with corporate jets departing and arriving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now comes a mystery jet, wearing no company colors, banking in over Lake Point Tower and WHISTLING low over the Planetarium to a touchdown. The white Learjet taxis to a halt at the far end of the field as an undistinguished Buick rolls down the ramp to meet it. Eddie and Kosalas stand by their car, parked across the runway from the Learjet. The jet's engines shut down, the door opens, and a grim but handsome man emerges. LUIS COMACHO, a cruel and uncompromising survivor, has arrived. With him is an incredibly beautiful exotic woman. He is met by Pompas and Efren Comacho, the two lookouts who survived the raid. And Victor Comacho, who was wounded in the raid, is here with his shoulder bandaged.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ...Lear 9 Lima Kilo number 2 for landing -- wind south 20, altimeter two-niner-niner-two...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From where Eddie and Kosalas are standing it is impossible to hear the conversation at the Learjet, but it is clear that Luis Comacho is upset. They see Luis slap Pompas and Efren. Then he grabs Victor by both arms, ignoring his wound, and screams at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Victor grimaces, in great pain, and his knees buckle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice fellow this Luis Comacho. Donato says they call him the Angel-of-Death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Real sweetheart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the dining room DIANA LUNA, a pretty 19 year old, helps her 80 year old grandmother THERESA decorate a "HAPPY BIRTHDAY" banner, some red and green crepe paper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana and her grandmother grin at each other. They are done. Theresa stands back to admire their work.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mama!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Daddy, would you get that! Diana rushes into the kitchen and comes right out with a birthday cake, and sets it on the table next to some presents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana goes to the stairs where her mother sits with her hands over her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leads her mother to the dining room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bella.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep 'em closed now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K., open 'em.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: opens her eyes. Theresa and Diana beam. Diana kisses her mother who almost cries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana hands Molly a card from the table. Molly starts to open it. Tony Luna burst in from another room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly heads for the stairs, leaving behind the half opened card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly goes upstairs. Diana is pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony goes to the phone, dials, gets a busy signal, and slams it down. Theresa sits down watching sadly. Diana goes to stand in front of her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony sorts through the closet looking for a jacket. Gamiani comes in puffing with a clumsily wrapped present under his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana is really angry at her father ignoring her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slaps her. She slaps him back, turns, grabs her purse, and runs out. Tony watches her go and turns to Gamiani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Molly comes down with the bag. Tony takes it from her and starts out the door. Suddenly he turns back, snatches Gamiani's present from his hands, and thrust it at his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony rushes out the door. Gamiani goes to the phone. Molly is left alone in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Happy birthday, momma.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in Italian) Happy birthday, Molly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Molly! Pack me a bag! Quick! Ok? C'mon I'm in a hurry!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But Tony, why...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Business! C'mon, move. Do what I tell you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't do it, momma! Make him pack his own bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I ain't got time to put up with your bullshit today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen goddammit! It's momma's birthday! She deserves better'n this!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Tony. What's shaking? Sorry I'm late. I got stuck on Wacker. Some spook...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Victor Comacho is alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh sweet Jesus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't go now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put someone on the house. And you keep an eye on her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it, Tony. What about your uncle?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What Felix don't know doesn't hurt him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here. Happy birthday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie parks in front of his apartment building, leaves the car, and enters the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead on his feet, Eddie reaches the top of the stairs and an object comes flying at him out of the shadows. ODELL, a slim 10 year old black kid, fakes a series of karate kicks at Eddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Odell takes off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kid stops, and Eddie tosses him the Rubic's Cube. Eddie nears his apartment, we hear a MALE VOICE SINGING.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bow to your master!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Later, Odell. It's been a rough one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: tellin me! We all seen it on the TV!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Odell!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bow to your master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Odell. Here, make yourself crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The door is ajar. Eddie lives in a modest apartment. FRED PIRELLI, a great bear of a man, 65, sings at the top of his lungs. He is bent over the space heater, tearing it apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie collapses on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Odell shows in the doorway. Eddie gets up and the kid tosses him the Rubic's Cube -- all done. Eddie looks at it, and the kid goes into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Odell laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie tosses the Cube into the waste basket and opens the refrigerator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie comes back into the living room, hands a beer and a soda to Odell, and flops back on the sofa with his own beer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli reaches for his drink and Odell hands him the soda. Pirelli grabs the beer before Odell can drink and switches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli and Odell turn to Eddie who tries to look innocent -- but fails. Eddie purposefully studies the answering machine on the coffee table in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli finishes with the heater, and gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie punches a button on the answering machine. It spews tape across the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli grabs the machine, unplugs it, and carries it out the door toward his own apartment.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You look like shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, pal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They had a shot on the tube of you guys comin' out in front of the building. How's Donato?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pissed cause he lost a shoe. (pause) Luis Comacho is in town.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll collect himself some scalps before this one's over. Your answering machine is on the fritz again. Some woman with a fantastic voice was callin' about comin' over this weekend ta help you with somthin', and then the tape went nuts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Want somthin' to drink?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Does the Pope shit in the woods? Is a bear Catholic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I hate smart ass kids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gonna get down in the 30's tonight. Your pilot light is out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been told that more than once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (seriously) So, who you figure pulled out the rug? Gypsies? Mob?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Somebody knew what they were doin'. They blew the top off an anthill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd figure the Mob but Scalese ain't that stupid. (pause) Hah! Sombody put the valve in backwards.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Odell! I ain't calling you again!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Later, fellas.

dialogue.raw_text: There. Heat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was the Cubs final score?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: 8 to 1.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Machines just don't like you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I don't like machines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The machine in question looks like a miniature tank. This is the "Prowler," a robot anti-terrorist vehicle that is being maneuvered around various obstacles in a demonstration for the city's law enforcement agencies. The "Prowler" is amazingly agile. And its BULLHORN VOICE breaks everybody up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The machine's three video eyes, searching the crowd independently, give it the appearance of an extra-industrial bug. One camera is mounted on a telescoping mast which extends to give it the perspective of a giraffe. The thing seems almost alive. Commander Kates is here, leading a contingent of departmental brass. With them are several dozen officers and a gaggle of city councilmen. The Prowler is being put through its paces by the FACTORY ENGINEER. He controls the machine with a pistol-grip device that looks like a small TV camera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns his hand to the right and the Prowler, 50 yards away, sweeps its turret to the right, aiming the twin 30 calibre machineguns at the politicians. They move aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Standing with Chief Kates, Eddie watches the demonstration with contempt. Kates turns to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie has seen enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates is about to say something when the demonstrator interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates points to Eddie, and smiles. Instantly the turret sweeps the horizon and locks on Eddie as he walks across the astro turf.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (from speaker) Arretez! Halten Zie! Stop! Do not move! No se mueve!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...After the gyros are locked, any movement of the hand controller is duplicated by the 'Prowler.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This simple control system means that even semi-skilled employees can operate the unit with a minimum of training. As they say, "Even a child can operate it."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's talking about you, Cusack. Pay attention. You're all gonna have to be qualified on this. It's the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just what the world needs, another gun without a brain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're looking at the perfect cop. The damn thing follows orders.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got better things to do than play with toys.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the Commander will pick someone to try and elude 'Prowler,' we can show how our various target acquisition systems function.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: -UP of the Prowler's hand controller. The MONITOR SCREEN shows the crosshairs on the back of Eddie's head. ON THE SCREEN the digital readout says: LOCKED AND TRACKING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie keeps walking, seemingly oblivious to the Prowler. Suddenly he whirls and ducks behind a wall out of the Prowler's sight. He pops up with his gun pointed at the Prowler's controller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The controller, scared shitless, drops the hand control. The Prowler dies -- the plug pulled. Eddie smiles at Kates, and exits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (from speaker) Bang. You're dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Drop it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The curtain is drawn back from the viewing window and the Comachos SEE the bodies of their cousins. Luis is here with Pompas, Efren, and Victor. Their attorney, Sanchez, has joined them. They are speaking Spanish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis says nothing. He looks through the window at the bodies. Finally he speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kisses his fingertips and touches the glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sanchez sighs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitle) A war does no good for any of us. It can only make what is bad worse.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitle) Get them out of here. Fix them up. I want them to be beautiful for their mother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitle) I promise you, my brothers, there will be blood for blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luis Comacho storms out of the room into the corridor followed by the others. Eddie and Kosalas are just entering. Victor spots Eddie and turns to Luis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Comachos slow down. The two groups survey each other -- Luis, hatred oozing from his eyes. And Eddie, without slowing, looks the vicious Colombian over with cool contempt. Eddie walks by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie freezes, makes a slow turn, and meets Luis' eyes. Suddenly Eddie moves, faster than anyone else can react to, and he has Luis pinned to the wall, choking him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He releases Luis just as quickly, and turns to walk out, Kosalas backing with him, hand on gun. Luis gets some air back, and starts to scream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other Comachos have to restrain him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) This is the cop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much did they pay you to set up my brothers, Pig.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stay off my streets, asshole. Or I'll bite your head off, and shit in your neck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitle) You're meat cop! Dead meat!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Retired detective HANK FLANNIGAN runs the high-tech morgue where the bodies are stacked on trays like bakery buns. Flannigan, a trim, bespectacled Mr. Clean, clicks his false teeth between thoughts. The body on the exotic lab table is the gunman Eddie shot during the raid. Eddie is here to confirm the identification. His new partner, Kosalas, is with him, very uncomfortable in this setting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flannigan has already pulled Verona's record. He hands it to Eddie who passes it on to Kosalas without looking at it. Kosalas concentrates on the file, uneasy with the dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie looks at Kosalas who glances up from the report triumphantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie just smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie reaches into his pocket, and tosses a ticket to Flannigan who grins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Eenie Verona is the gentleman's name. (looks down) You did a hell of a job on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was motivated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Know him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's a punk. Punk thief. Booster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like he graduated.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He had a brother-in-law. They were tight. Served time together. Ganelli..., Gagleone...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gamiani.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I was you, I'd sit on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You figure he's connected?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like you're gonna be busy, Cusack. Uh, you gonna be using those Cubs' tickets?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie and Kosalas cruise the Rush Street area at night. They search the neon lit crowds on the sidewalks for a glimpse of Lou Gamiani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a tree-shaded block of classic brownstones, the unmarked car is parked at the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie is at the wheel wearing a sportscoat and sweater, scanning the sports page. Kosalas is nervous and chatty, bubbling. He's still reading the records from the morgue.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This Ganiani's a swinger, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's just makin' up for the time he spent in the joint.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Italian, and huge, comes out the front door of a brownstone, and gives a perfunctory kiss to his aging "Playmate", who stands in the doorway in a housecoat. Gamiani comes down the steps, and jumps into a car. In the car with Gamiani, a fat man, TITO, is at the wheel. They pull into the street passing the unmarked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trailing Gamiani and his partner through the North Side neighborhoods, they wind up in Lincoln Park. With considerable skill Kosalas and Eddie manage to stick to them undetected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gamiani and Tito park by the botanical gardens and stroll past the fields of flowers into the zoo. Eddie and Kosalas follow.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now what? They selling protection to the bears?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Relax kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Strolling among the baby elephants and fuzzy rabbits, the two heavies could not be more out of place. Tito has a racing form. Lou, tall enough to see over heads, looks like a loose gorilla on the prowl. He is searching for somebody. Surrounding the incubators filled with hatching chicks is a cluster of schoolchildren. They are having a ball. Eddie has noticed DIANA, a lovely 19 year old who is in charge of the children. And she has noticed Gamiani. She's visibly upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana leaves the children with the zoo lecturer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She crosses to the two goons and looks up at Gamiani.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gamiani shrugs, his pal Tito seems embarrassed, but they don't move.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) What's this? Kinda young for that old fart ain't she?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Just watch, kid. Learn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be back in a minute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Papa worries about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get out of here, Lou. Leave me alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The CHILDREN SCREAM, and LULU, the half-ton baboon flies into frame, swinging down from the artificial branches of an iron tree in the three story central cage. The children clutch at Diana in delightful terror. The gorilla, inches away, kisses the thick glass that separates them. Lulu swings to the upper branches and sits, arms crossed, staring eyeball-to-eyeball at her human counterpart, Gamiani. Tito eats popcorn. Eddie and Kosalas walk behind a mother and child, each holding a balloon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana is on the front steps of the library saying good-bye to two of the children from the zoo. She hands them over to their mothers, and goes up the steps into the building. Gamiani and Tito pull over and park down the street. Eddie comes around the corner, and follows her in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sign on the door tells us this is the city's Special Education Program office. Diana enters the office and confers briefly with another staff member.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the open door of the Special Education Program office, Eddie observes Diana chatting with her co-workers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie follows as Diana walks through the great hall past long tables and out the other door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana comes down the steps, wading through the swarm of homebound commuters, and catches a cab. And head and shoulders above the crowd, scanning the tops of heads, is Lou Gamiani. Tito comes around the corner in his car, and pulls up to the curb. Gamiani jumps in, and they take off after Diana's cab. Eddie and Kosalas follow in Eddie's car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana enters an apartment building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time Diana exits it is dark. She is with a friend, and both are in some kind of Halloween costume. They catch a cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The taxi stops in front of an ancient brick loft building. Diana and her friend get out and hit the buzzer at an unmarked door. The door opens and they disappears inside. Gamiani's car cruises past. It pulls up at the corner and it's lights switch off. Eddie's car pulls up. Eddie hops out. Kosalas slides behind the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie leans down to the open drivers window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie goes to the back of the car, and Kosalas follows him in the rearview mirror, losing sight when Eddie pops open the trunk. Kosalas watches the party goers enter the building. There is a tapping at the window. Eddie has donned a baseball uniform, matching cap, and now carries a baseball bat with a pair of cleats hanging from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie tosses the keys back to Kosalas, and heads to the building. Kosalas calls to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold here a second.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep with Gamiani.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bang a few for me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the darkened stairway Eddie joins a group of outrageously dressed characters. The door at the top of the stairs bursts open on a punk-funk art student Halloween party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hundred people are jammed into the studio. It feels like the Star Wars Saloon. The LIVE MUSICIANS match the look of the party. The costumes are outrageous. Everyone is dancing. Eddie looks the place over. He spots Diana. Eddie walks over to her, grabbing a drink along the way. He sidles up to Diana.

Two hearses, a flower car, a limo, and several other cars with funeral stickers on their windshields pass bye. The slain Comacho cousins from the raid are being escorted to the cemetery. Luis Comacho is in the limo along with the woman from the airport.

At the end of the block, an old man is selling produce to the neighborhood housewives off the tailgate of his truck. They watch the procession in wonder.

direction.raw_text: A tan Dodge rolls over the rutted scrapyard roadway, bouncing toward the immense old warehouse along the river's edge. The city seems to have abandoned this remote industrial area; giant grain elevators, rusting freighters and vast scrapyards surround us.

direction.raw_text: Luis is directing things as they are preparing for battle. The weaponry spread on the table is astonishing.

direction.raw_text: A kid on a bike makes his way up the quiet tree-lined street, tossing newspapers onto the porches of the block. Around the corner at the end of the block, the produce truck starts slowly forward. As it turns onto Luna's block, a car pulls up behind it and stops, blocking the street. The produce truck parks at the curb in front of the Luna house. A neighbor from across the street approaches. The front door of Luna's house opens, and Tito emerges, helping Tony's aged mother down the steps to buy vegetables.

direction.raw_text: On the floor near the wheelwell is the dead produce man.

direction.raw_text: Bits and pieces. A Shattered orange juice container. Eggs cooking on the stove. A woman's vanity. On the floor; a woman's legs, a housecoat, slippers. A silhouette of a Comacho in the hallway RAKING one of Tony's guards. A family photo on the mantle which includes Diana and her father is BLASTED to bits.

direction.raw_text: The street is QUIET again. Next door, a neighbor, wearing only his underpants and carrying an old pistol, stands trembling in disbelief.

direction.raw_text: Pines reflect in the dappled lake as Tony Luna rows slowly for shore. He ties up at the dock. He's taking his tackle out of the boat when one of his boys comes running down to the dock. We cannot hear the conversation but we can see Tony drop the tackle box and we can hear his SCREAM echo across the water.

direction.raw_text: Distracted for an instant by a cluster of conventioneers, Lou fails to notice the two Comachos who have fallen in step behind them. He goes down with a gasp, almost silently, a knife sticking from his back. A Comacho grabs Diana's arm. She jabs him in the eyes, and runs. Diana disappears into the crowd. Hysterical citizens scatter in all directions. A woman stands in horror unable to keep from looking at Gamiani's body lying on the sidewalk. She SCREAMS. Eddie and Kosalas come crashing out of the entrance of the museum. The girl isn't here. Eddie spots a commotion at the end of the block, under the el station. He dashes down the steps and across the street with traffic screeching to a halt. Kosalas flags down a blue and white, and barks for backup, then tears out after Eddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the shadow of the el tracks, Diana runs for her life, racing north on Wabash through crowds of shoppers with the Comachos moving relentlessly a half block behind. Opposite Marshall Field's, she abruptly cuts across traffic and runs into an alley between the giant men's and women's stores. With terror in her eyes, Diana runs, searching frantically for a guard, a policeman, somebody with a gun. But the Comachos are closing in on her. She dives through a revolving door into the building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diana runs past the perfume displays, notions, and lingerie, and out the Randolph Street exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two Camachos, who stayed on the street, spot her as she leaves. Racing through the alley, Eddie spots them running in the next block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Running east on Lake Street, she glances over her shoulder. She doesn't see them. She ducks into the alley. But the Comachos round the corner just in time to catch a glimpse of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This alley leads to the lower level of Michigan Avenue. She turns back to find the exit blocked by the Comachos. She flees downward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The green flourescents of the "Emerald City" give a deathly cast to the underground street as Diana rounds the corner, and collapses against the wall. Her heart pounding like a frightened deer, she has run as far as she can. Pompas Comacho and two of his colleagues come racing around the corner. They spot her crouched against the wall. She starts to SCREAM but Angel grabs her by the collar and pulls her up to his face and she stops, wide-eyed with terror as he touches her throat with his knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We hear a loud metallic CLICK. We see the barrel of a huge revolver. They wheel to see Eddie crouched, gun drawn, in the alley entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boys put their hands up, but Eddie doesn't see the third, SAMO, coming up behind him. Angel grabs Diana by the hair, shielding himself, and starts backing up the stairs that lead to the street.

direction.raw_text: Samo jumps Eddie, and the gun goes flying. It hits the pavement and bounces off the high curb into the street. In a staggering blur Eddie takes out the Comachos, kicking the last one end over end. But Angel and the girl have disappeared to the street above. Eddie retrieves his gun and runs up the steps.

direction.raw_text: With a knife at her side, Angel Comacho leads Diana up the steps of the old el station. They pass through the turnstyle out onto the platform just as the train pulls to in. Angel forces her onto the train. Eddie comes pounding up the steps and onto the platform just in time to stop the closing train door with his foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie wedges his way aboard and the train pulls out. The passengers looks at him like he's crazy. Eddie works his way through the cars toward the rear. Angel spots him. Knife still in hand, he pulls Diana from car to car past the terrified passengers until finally he is cornered at the end of the train. Angel searches frantically for a way out. Eddie enters. Diana sees him.

direction.raw_text: Eddie takes another step. Diana slams her elbow into Angel's groin, and breaks free. Angel jumps back. He breaks open the rear door and climbs out.

direction.raw_text: Angel climbs up the back of the car onto the roof. Eddie's right behind him. The spectacular pursuit from car to car on the roof of the speeding el train is witnessed by startled second-floor secretaries whose desks look directly out at the roof of the passing cars.

direction.raw_text: Angel and Eddie's figures appear as specks, roaring through the canyon of skyscrapers.

direction.raw_text: A low bridge forces both men to hug the roof of the train. Eddie recovers first and grabs Angel, pulling him down. They roll from side to side on the roof, nearly slipping over the side. With a desperate shove, Angel breaks free. Eddie points his gun at him. The train is now over the Chicago River. Angel dives into the water. Eddie reholsters his gun and dives in after him.

direction.raw_text: We see Diana's looking out the window of the train. She follows Eddie's decent with her eyes.

direction.raw_text: Dozens of startled pedestrians line the bridge railing as Eddie swims toward Angel, bobbing in the middle of the stream. A hotdogger in a speedboat is racing up the river and Angel is directly in his path. The skipper, showing off for his passengers, doesn't notice him until he hears the sickening THUNK under the keel. The boat's wake is suddenly red with blood.

direction.raw_text: Eddie is helped from the water by a couple of passersby. He stands there, soaking wet, looking around. A crowd is gathering. We hear SIRENS in the background. Then he spots her. Diana is standing on the bridge watching him.

direction.raw_text: Eddie, now in dry clothes, and Diana walk along the lagoon. They talk, argue, and she sits on a bench and cries. Eddie comforts her.
