dialogue.raw_text: Does a bear...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Am I putting you on the spot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I spent 30 years on the spot. What ever you need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eddie?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be right across the hall. I'm just gonna clean up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie falls fully clothed onto the mattress. The PHONE RINGS. He rolls over in disbelief, staring at the ceiling. It RINGS, and RINGS again and again and again. He finally picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the after-hours watering hole for the police force and half the cops we've seen so far, including Cragie, are clustered at the bar or playing darts at the back of the room. There are a half a dozen women there also. Three of them are cops. Kosalas is here too. He's been drinking. He leans against the wall talking on the pay phone by the men's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hangs up and heads back to his table, passing Officer Music at the bar.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to phone) Say, Eddie. Why don' you come by and tip a few? (pause) Cause I gotta talk to you. (pause) Yeah, I know. But we gotta talk. (pause) Please. (pause) Yeah, at Mike's.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You oughta crash, man. You had a helluva day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two tough looking guys are watching the entrance to the bar from a car parked across the street. We can HEAR the NOISE from the BAR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They check their weapons.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Love it, Flash. Gonna be a slide. Easy in, easy out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a quick and dirty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, yeah, nothin to it. You know the drill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everybody but Kosalas is having a good time. Donato, flanked by two girls, foot up on a chair, entertains a small crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group laughs at the story. There is a stillness at the front door. One of the hoods from outside steps in. He wears a leather coat. The heads at the bar turn. He walks the length of the bar and enters the john. He is obviously out of place in this saloon. Nobody has both hands on the bar. The front door opens. The other hood steps in, walks up to the bar, and orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The First Hood comes out of the bathroom and walks up to the bar. Suddenly he whips a sawed-off shotgun from under his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THIRTY HAMMERS CLICK. Thirty guns are drawn. The room is frozen. Only the JUKEBOX makes a sound. The two hoods, eyes fixed on the array of iron pointed at them, can't even swallow. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cops swarm the hoods and in an instant they are on the floor being cuffed and roughly handled. Kosalas is at the end of the bar, frozen, his gun still in his holster.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He picks her up on Forty-third, and he's takin' in. She says, "Say, baby. Ain't no need for goin' downtown." An' she pulls back her skirt. So the dumb shit climbs in the back an' takes a piece... (starts to chuckle) ...an' leaves the keys in the front and locks the two of 'em in the squad. And he hasta kick out the window see, an' she starts screamin', "Rape! Rape!" An' they charge him with rape an' every other fuckin' thing in the book. Internal Affairs is gonna give him a kayak and a lantern an' put him out in the lake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bartender. Gimme a black russian and a Courvoisier.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (bellows) Yo! Get your hands up motherfuckers. This is a ho --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to partner) You stupid motherfucker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie gets out of his car and heads for the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is in an uproar -- everybody doubled up with LAUGHTER -- as the two luckless hoods, handcuffed together, are lying on the filthy tavern floor under a table. They continue to berate each other. Eddie enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato spots Eddie and calls to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ruthie giggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marlene swats at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie shakes his head and walks to the back of the room where Kosalas sits hunched over a drink, the only man in the room not laughing. He looks up whens Eddie pulls over a chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie nods, and Kosalas signals the waitress. There is a long beat at Kosalas fidgets and Eddie waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie just looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie is still silent. Kosalas takes a swig of his beer, and finally blurts is out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is too loud, and attracts attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie gets up and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My old lady tol' me you was fucked up in the head. Do I listen? Piece o cake, you say. Snap, you say. Nothin to it, you say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Eddie! Partner! Meet Ruthie. Dental Hygienist. She's oral.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And this is... Marlene. She works for a proctologist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Siddown, partner. I got a proposition for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not now, Donato.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K. O.K. But just let me plant two words in your brain. Alligator farming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like I'm caught between the rock and the hard place, Sarge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know I really wanted to be a good cop, but... shit. It's hard enough sometimes just to stay alive. Comes so easy to you. You got all the fuckin' answers. Me, I'm still tryin' to find the questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cragie planted the gun on the kid. Just wasted him, and then I... I don't know what to do about the hearing tomorrow...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell the truth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: See. It's all so nothin' for you. If I talk straight every cop on the force will shit on me. If I don't... Cragie gets away with murder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the chance to do it again. Next time he might take away a cop. That make any difference?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's my partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your partner's selling you out, Kosalas. He kills an unarmed kid, and now he's risking your ass to save his own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was a mistake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It cost an innocent kid his life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know that! I KNOW THAT!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Jesus. I see that kid's face every time I close my eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell 'em like it is, Nick. I'll back you up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The two amateur holdup men are being hustled out to the paddy wagon as Eddie heads for the door. Someone grabs his arm. It's Cragie, a little drunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie walks out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nice to see you out with the boys for a change, Sarge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Cragie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They tell me my Sergeant wouldn't sign for me. You want to tell me why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know why.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Tell me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (gently) You were a good cop for a lot of years. You've passed your limit now Cragie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you. Where do you get off?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right about here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie buzzes the door. Pirelli opens it. He lets Eddie in, scans the hall, and closes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli sets down his gun, and pours Eddie a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: She's havin' a bad night. Gave her a shot of brandy. Maybe she'll sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Giving liquor to a minor, Pirelli?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be back right after the hearing tomorrow, and you can get some sleep then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie cracks the door and peeks in. Diana sits on the bed, a lonely forlorn figure. She looks at Eddie, and tries a smile that fails. Eddie walks over to sit on the bed next to her. She falls apart, and lies down, on the verge of crying, collapsing so that her head rest in Eddie's lap. They are quiet like that for a moment, she curled into a ball, Eddie stroking her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie lays on the bed beside her. She curls up in his arms, and closes her eyes. Eddie's eyes remain open.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you do when you don't have anyone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You find someone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could you... Hold me for a while?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Civilian Review Board is in the Office of Professional Standards. The panel consists of eight civilians. It is a real cross-section of the city of Chicago. Leon Partida chairs the proceedings. We recognize several faces from the opening bust. An old Mexican woman is on the stand facing the panel. Cragie sits at a table with his representative, facing the officials. A female panel member is questioning the old woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question must be TRANSLATED by a bumbling clerk, the old woman answers in Spanish, then the answer is translated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room is packed. In addition to the police officers, character witnesses, and friends of the dead kid, there are a dozen reporters. Eddie enters and looks over the scene. He nods to Donato, sitting at the rail with his foot propped up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie takes a seat. Officer Cragie is called back to the witness stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie is neat as a pin, humble, cooperative to a fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He feigns compassion.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: EL MEMBER How far were you standing from where your grandson was shot, Mrs. Murillio?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the next doorway. Four meters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How you doin', Sarge?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the score?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (nods toward witness) Kid's grandmother says Cragie threw down the pistola.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to steno) Officer Cragie has already been sworn. (pause) Officer Cragie, you have heard Mrs. Murillio's testimony -- CRAGIE Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have heard her tell this panel that she saw you lay the gun in her grandson's hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not saying the woman would make this up. But there's no way she could have seen anything from where she was standing in a hallway that dark. (pause) Like you said, she's the boy's grandmother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If it was dark, Officer, how were you sure Vega had a gun?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We were lucky. There was a glint of light, a reflection comin off the barrel of the weapon.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A carload of Comachos, including Luis, cruises down the street and parks in the alley next to Eddie's building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hearing is in recess and the hall is filled with smokers and coffee drinkers. Eddie is getting a BUSY SIGNAL on the pay phone. Donato approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie dials the number again. Still a busy signal.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You think he'll get a pass?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You heard it all. What do you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the hearing was over I'd have to put my money on the old lady. (smiles) But Kosalas's next. My bet's on Cragie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The kid may surprise you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pirelli has Eddie's answering machine plugged in, and is tinkering with the insides. Diana comes into the living room, toweling her wet hair, just out of the shower, but in her street clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas is on the witness stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie leans back. A ripple is felt in the crowd. The reaction of the boy's relatives, delayed by translation, is one of outrage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Kosalas steps down he keeps his eyes on the floor ahead of him avoiding eye contact. Eddie leans back in his seat. A couple of people get up and head for the door. Eddie gets to his feet and heads for the door. Partida hits the gavel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie halts with his hand on the knob.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And right after you heard Officer Cragie's gun discharge, what did you do then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I immediately advanced down the hall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what did you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The deceased, Vega, lying on the floor. Officer Cragie was checking his vital signs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened then?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We recovered a .25 calibre automatic from the teenager's right hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you see that weapon in Vega's hand before Officer Cragie fired?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No more questions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'd like to now call Sergeant Cusack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pirelli works on the answering machine, but the phone is reconnected. Diana is looking at photographs on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pirelli looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He goes back to the machine.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You made that uniform look good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That good looking gorilla next to me is Eddie's father. Better than good cop. Killed in the line of duty. '71. (pause) Another cop shot him. An accident.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Comachos come up the stairs, led by Luis. They stop at Eddie's door. They pull out their guns, and kick the door in. Across the hall, Pirelli's door opens, and Pirelli, holding his pistol steps into the hall. The Comachos turn and fire, blasting Pirelli back into his apartment. Through the open door we see Diana dash across the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis and his men burst in. Diana runs for the phone. A Comacho takes it from her and rips it from the wall. Diana is caught by two Comachos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie is on the witness stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partida lifts a document from the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room listens to every word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Partida lifts another document.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie glances over the letter and hands it back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't comment on that. It was over before I got there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are his superior officer, are you not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cragie's in my unit, yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you give the men their various assignments?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you request that officer Cragie be on your TAC team?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sergeant... I have here a department document dated 24 September, of last year. It is a request by you, to your superiors, to have Officer Cragie transferred to another unit. Are you familiar with this document?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why did you request his transfer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe 30 years is too long for anyone to look at the city's guts, Mr. Partida.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened to this request?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was denied.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a letter of support for Officer Cragie. (hands it to him) Everyone in his unit signed it but you. (pause) Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't agree with what it says.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you saying you do not believe Officer Cragie is fit to work the streets of Chicago?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I'm saying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The reporters are clustered around Eddie as he emerges but he walks past them back to the pay phone. He puts in a quarter and dials. Frowns. The cops in the corridor are passing the word about Eddie's testimony, discussing it in little clusters. Their appearance is frightening. Eddie dials another number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie, backed up by a couple of buddies, comes up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie drops the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to phone) I just dialed 348-6610, and I get this funny buzz. Check the line for me? Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Seems to me the man's got his tongue stuck to his asshole, Cragie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, that don't bother him. He's the fuckin White Knight. (to Eddie) You wanna take on the whole world by yourself? Now you're gonna get your chance, Sarge.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from phone) Sorry, sir, that number seems to be out of service. I've reported it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie races down the hallway past hostile clusters of former friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roaring north on the boulevard without regard to traffic, Eddie speeds toward his house in his rattling Chevy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie rockets through the red lights LEANING on his HORN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie runs up the stairs, and slows when he sees Odell. The boy is sitting on the floor, head in his hands, crying. Just past Odell, several uniformed policemen are standing over Pirelli's body. They step back as Eddie approaches.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He was a friend of yours wasn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie hurries to the bedroom and back. He rushes out of the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie runs for the Chevy and peels away from the curb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie is on the radio, speeding west on Diversey Parkway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to mike) Squad, this is 1462. I need a backup. Have 64 and 63 from TAC 4 meet me at the billiard parlor on 18th near Halsted. Questioning suspects.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Music is standing on a streetcorner talking to a couple of hookers. Down the street, Brennan waits in their unmarked car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (from speaker)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brennan picks up the mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Music returns to the car and gets in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: and 1464, Unit 1462 requesting assistance at the poolroom on 18th Street near Halsted. Questioning a suspect.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to mike) Ten-four, Dispatch. Unit 1463 responding.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could use a cup of coffee.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie squeals to a stop, hops out of the car, starts for the pool hall. Eddie enters the poolhall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is busy. Everybody in sight is either mean or ugly. Eddie enters and a dozen pair of eyes are on him. The pool players not connected with this confrontation take one look at him, hang up their cues, and split. Eddie heads for the back of the room. A pair of heavyweights fall in behind him. One of them grabs Eddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie spins with deadly precision and catches them in mid- step and they go down like gut-shot rhinos. He heads for the rear hallway and everybody clears a path. He steps up to the door in back and kicks it in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you ain't got no business back there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want your opinion I'll beat it out of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A startled Camacho, DEGAS, looks up, straw in hand with a line of coke on a mirror on his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie grabs Degas by the hair and starts slamming his face into the mirror which shatters with every blow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds up Degas' head to look him in the eye. Blood and cocaine stain the man's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie lifts the head once and gives Degas one punch in the face that sends him ass over teakettle across the floor.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where is Luis?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get the hell out of here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Talk to me, Degas, or I'll hit you with so many lefts you're gonna beg for a right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's coming here. He's on his way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beneath the lighted map of Area 4, the police dispatcher trying to raise Eddie's backup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The dispatcher at the next panel overhears the call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First dispatcher nods.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We need a verification on a back-up for Unit 1462...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . That's Cusack, right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good luck finding a backup for that character.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie opens the door and emerges from the back room. A dozen Comacho goons have gathered. Behind them are another two dozen hostile spectators. But no sign of the backup. He pulls out his gun. The remaining innocent bystanders split for the exit. Eddie walks forward into the room. The Comachos and their soldiers stand around him. Several have guns. Eddie keeps them under the point of his gun. He gets to the door and has to turn his back on it to keep the gang in his sights. A gun is pressed into Eddie's back. He drops his gun. Luis kicks Eddie across the room. Eddie lands at the feet of the gang.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie springs to his feet, and in the same motion decks his nearest attacker. The battle is on. Hardwood pool cues crack around him. The first four or five never get a chance to lay a finger on him. Battered and broken, they litter the billiard tables and floor. But Eddie is outnumbered 20 to 1.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Take him apart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cragie and Kosalas sit at the bar. The TV is off, and the few customers pay attention to the police monitor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie smiles. Kosalas looks ashamed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) ...request verification for backup for unit 1462. Patrol 47, are you in the area.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) Squad. 47. We're having vehicular problems. Not able to respond.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Two uniformed police sit in a cruiser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One cop turns to the other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) ...need backup at 18th and Halstead...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coming at Eddie now from all sides, the Comachos wear into him. Finally they begin to connect. Blind-sided, he goes down and they are on him like jackals. They drag him to the top of the rear stairs, and kick him down to the alley. It seems like they are about to finish him off when suddenly all is quiet. The crowd parts. Eddie looks up through swollen eyes to see Luis Comacho standing above him, cool as ice. Luis reaches down and pulls Eddie's head up by the ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis kicks him in the face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The sun comes up. You give me Luna, or the girl dies -- slow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie opens a bloody eye and looks over his surroundings. He's alone. He moves, a joint at a time, checking himself out. Staggering to his feet, he opens a spiggot on the wall. He lets the cold water wash over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato hobbles through the deserted pool hall, his pistol in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato comes out the back door of the poolhall, and finds Eddie sitting on his haunches and resting against a wall between two garbage cans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Donato holsters his gun, and helps Eddie to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie runs down the alley toward his car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I would have been here, Sarge. They kept it from me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're Ok, Hopalong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, I'm havin' a drink with this friend of mine, name of Mickie. She works on a computer over in the Federal Building, FBI. I got here as soon as I heard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They got Diana Luna.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I'm tryin' to tell ya. Mickie told me she read on the wire Tony Luna's comin' into Union Station at ten tonight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie's car pulls up. He gets out and runs inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A train sits at the platform. Tony Luna is walking down the platform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie runs through the cavernous lobby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie arrives in time to see Tony step into a waiting Cadillac that immediately takes off. Eddie races up the ramp to his car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie jumps into his car, and roars away in pursuit of the Cadillac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony settles in, and then sees Scalese sitting calmly in the back seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony moves for his gun. The hood next to Tony relieves him of his gun, using his own for persuasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony is scared. The driver spots something in the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised) Hello, Felix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Tony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighs) You see, Tony. You make no sense. You start a war... Waste people... Money... You're like a kid, Tony. You're a bad boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac rockets through the empty orange-lighted canyons of the financial district, with Eddie in hot pursuit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roaring north on Wacker past an astonished group in front of the Civic Opera House, the Cadillac drops out of sight on the down-ramp to Lower Wacker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This bi-level street is as different as night and day. The lower level's eerie green lights make us feel like we're under water. Iron girders and concrete pillars support the street above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac races through this vast man-made cavern, past the sub-level loading docks and service entrances of skyscrapers above. City work crews and all night commercial deliveries dot both the upper and lower levels of the chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie is gaining in the battered Chevy. The Cadillac rockets up the next ramp to the street level.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac zooms up from below, crosses the intersection, and immediately takes the next down-ramp. Eddie flies up from below, briefly airborne, barreling after them into the tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A block later the Cadillac heads topside again. Eddie takes a gamble and goes straight ahead. At the next down-ramp, the Cadillac descends and Tony's boys find themselves doing 70 knots side by side with Eddie in the other lane. In the narrow concrete tunnel, the two cars battle each other like bulls in a chute, each one trying to cut the other off, bouncing from each other into the walls and back again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The goon next to Luna is trying to get a shot off at Eddie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tony sees his chance and he lunges for the gun. In the struggle, the gun goes off and drills Rocco, the driver, through the side of the head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This sonovabitch is crazy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Cadillac ROARS out of control, its dead driver's foot pressing the accelerator to the floor. Scalese, in the front seat, tries to grab the wheel. Eddie is all over the road trying to avoid them. The river and the curve are ahead. Scalese's car hits the median at high speed, rolls, and slides SCREAMING into a concrete pillar and EXPLODES. Eddie stands on the brakes as his car slides alongside the flaming wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie's car is on fire now, and the doors have been rammed shut. He kicks the window out on the passenger side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie runs for his life. The explosion knocks him to his knees. He gets up and moves away, looking back at Luna's and Scalese's spectacular funeral pyre.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fire engines and police cars are arriving from every direction. With the flames still lighting his face, Eddie is making a call.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You tell Luis I got Tony Luna for him. Get me a time and place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Diana is in bad shape. She is tied up. Numb with terror she listens, not comprehending, as the Comachos discuss their plans for her in Spanish. Luis comes over to her, and with his knife begins cutting off part of her clothes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your cop friend is smart. Too smart and he dies. Then I take care of you personally.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eddie's car is totally ablaze. He walks past the streaming hoses and slips into a parked blue and white, it's mars lights still flashing. He roars off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giant door opens, and a lone blue and white pulls in and parks. The place is deserted except for the duty officer who sits in his tiny office watching television with his half-naked girlfriend. Eddie enters silently, glances into the duty office, and heads to the other end of the large hall. In the background we see the practice apartment set, the boxing ring, and several special task force undercover vehicles seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie opens his locker and takes out his sawed-off automatic shotgun. He checks the action. He loads it. He fills a duffle bag with ammo and drops in another gun. He closes the locker and heads out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The duty officer is still occupied. Eddie eases past him and checks the key-board at the desk. He finds what he's looking for. He lifts a set of keys from the hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside, we hear the SOUND of a TRUCK STARTING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This city garbage van, an immense blue semi-trailer, is moving south on the Dan Ryan at incredible speed, pushing traffic out of the way like a battleship slicing through Sunday boaters. Eddie is at the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Among the dockside ruins of the old facility, Luis carefully checks his snipers and lookouts. Shouting in Spanish, he directs them into position. From the distance we see a signal from the Comacho stationed at the top of a huge grain elevator overlooking the Calumet Harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas enters. The place is in chaos. He joins the crowd gathered in the center of the facility. Brennan and Cragie are here. So is Music. Commander Kates has just arrived.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas wanders through the wreckage. He is stunned. He is starting to wake up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men all look at him silently. Kosalas turns on them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is mad and loud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cragie jumps at Kosalas, but Kosalas is ready for him, and braces Cragie against the wall. With one hand Kosalas slams Cragie again, and reaches down with his free hand, lifting Cragie's pants leg and extracting a drop-gun from it's concealed holster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kates steps in and separates them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What the hell is goin on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cusack made off with a truckload of armour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shakes his head) He's a fucking one man army now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What'd I tell ya. The sonofabitch is crazy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: everybody. No more games. Where's Cusack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't swallow this shit! Eddie Cusack's out there takin' on the world by himself. And you fuckin' heros are gonna sit on your goddamn asses!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cool it kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you fuckin' tell me to cool it. I won't cool it. I'm not going to fuckin' lie for you any more. (to Kates) I lied, Commander. He laid a gun on that kid. I saw the whole thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You little fuckin' bastard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's this for partner? Your next fuck up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the others) Get someone in the air. We're gonna find Cusack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Diana, now hanging from her wrists like a slab of beef, is guarded by a couple of Luis' boys, eyeing her hungrily. Luis enters.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Take off the gag. I want them to hear her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luis scans the daybreak sky. He and Efren take up positions. Above them and around them, every line of fire is covered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the lookout's POV atop the towering grain elevator, WE SEE several garbage trucks moving in and out of an adjacent dump. One of them seems familiar to us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie's eyes search the harbour as he maneuvers slowly alongside a rusting freighter. He stops and gets out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddie opens the rear of the truck and lowers a ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up his gun and a duffle bag from the cab and heads out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here we go partner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Comachos are ready and waiting. Luis walks through the middle of the vast empty plant toward the front, checking on his troops one last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Against the grotesque shapes of the surrounding scrapyards, Eddie moves quickly from one concealment to the next, crouched low, advancing on the abandoned factory at the end of the dock. He lays down his duffle and pulls out a Halliburton case. He opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From inside the garbage truck WE HEAR an ENGINE STARTING. It REVS a couple of times. And from within the container compartment of the truck emerges the Prowler. It clatters down the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lookout spots the Prowler moving down the dock. He can't believe his eyes. He sights on the machine and FIRES. And in the distance, the Prowler senses the insult and immediately turns its camera eye up to him. The lookout FIRES again. Immediately, the turret swivels and the twin MACHINEGUNS ROAR. It's a long way down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SOUND of MACHINEGUN FIRE from outside galvanizes the Comachos. Luis runs through the long building toward the front with half a dozen of his men, all SHOUTING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eddies eyes watch the miniature monitor of the Prowler's hand controller. On the monitor WE CAN SEE the Comachos running out in the front of the factory from the camera on top of the Prowler. Eddie gets up and moves toward the factory. He looks up at several high broken windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Prowler is having a field day. It's electronic sensors trace the source of every hostile shot and immediately return a withering stream of hot lead that chews the surrounding scenery -- and several Comachos -- to pieces. But Eddie has not figured out how to control the Prowler's BULLHORN VOICE command system. It continues to BARK ORDERS to the dead hoodlums in three languages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luis runs through the empty plant toward the office screaming to Diana's guards.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (subtitles) Now! Do it now! Kill her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Diana, tied to the chair, is momentarily alone as the guards rush out to the floor of the factory to see what's happening. The two guards, their guns flying from their hands, are hammered back into the room by Eddie who blasts through the door after them. Diana is petrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas and Kates are in the same car. Kosalas is driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kosalas spins the wheel into a U-turn.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (from radio) ...Harbor Patrol reports gunfire and explosions in the vicinity of Calumet Harbor...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's Cusack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The "Prowler" rolls around the corner, its brutal turret bristling with firepower. It is driving Luis and the other stupefied Comachos further back into the building. Eddie guides his deadly partner with the hand controller. The Comachos dive for cover and spray the miniature tank with AUTOMATIC FIRE. But they are no match. Two continuous streams of hot lead chew up the place, splintering the loading dock and the catwalk hiding places and disintegrating the structure, churning the Comachos to hamburger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: RINGS OUT Eddie goes down and the Prowler hand controller falls to the ground, shattered. The Prowler goes berserk, SPRAYING DEATH in a 360 degree circle until all the ammo is gone. Then SILENCE. Eddie touches the blood on the side of his leg. It's not serious. It appears everyone is out of ammunition. But a few Comachos are still hidden in the factory. Eddie is after them like a tiger. Victor, shoulder still bandaged, never has a chance. He goes down, battered and broken. But Luis has crept up behind Eddie. He jumps over a steel plate. He's going for Diana, a long knife in his hand. Eddie reaches for a reload. Puts it in his magnum. Aims, and blows Luis away just as he reaches for Diana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Across the littered battlefield, Eddie escorts Diana toward the light streaming through the factory entrance. He takes off his jacket and wraps it around Diana's shoulders.
direction.name: direction
